title.narrative: SOCIAL ASSISTANCE STRENGTHENING

description.narrative: The Government of Angola has a strengthened social assistance institutional and operational framework, for substantial scale up of main social protection interventions, which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2019, the most vulnerable boys and girls will have increased access to social assistance programs, through improvement of policy environment and systems

participating-org.narrative: DIRECCAO NAC DE ACCAO SOCIAL MINARS

mailing-address.narrative: P.O. Box 2707 Luanda Republic of Angola

sector.narrative: Cash Transfers: Delivery of cash transfers through government system (beneficiary identification, grievance mechanisms, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)

Cash Transfers: Technical support to government cash transfer system development and expansion (design, targeting, beneficiary selection, grievance mechanism, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)

Contributing to policies reducing child poverty: Poverty reduction strategies, national development plans, engagement with ministries, parliament, international donor and financial organizations, civil society organizations)
National social protection strategies: Policies, strategies, legislation and coordination (inter-ministerial, donor)
Social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: The Government of Angola has a strengthened social assistance institutional and operational framework, for substantial scale up ofmain social protection interventions

description.narrative: Improved social protection agenda in Angola: (a) implementation of the first social cash transfer programme in Angola, reaching 11,473 children; (b) Integrated Social Action Centers (CASI) operating in 3 provinces. | Status:Met | As-of Date:17/07/2019

3.2 Evidence generated on budgets and their linkages to child outcomes to improve budget allocations/expenditure for children

baseline.value: 6 budget briefs on key social sectors

target.value: 2019:8 budget briefs on social sectors, decentralisation and next years budget proposal

actual.value: 2019:8 budget briefs: 6 social sectors plus a general 2019 budget brief, as well as a 2020 rapid analysis of budget proposal

title.narrative: Integrated Centers of Social Assistance are in place(36931)
Cash transfers: Cash transfer system DESIGNED including expanding coverage and improving inclusion of children (e.g design, targeting, beneficiary selection, cash delivery and overall financing)

actual.value: 2019:Cash Transfers Pilot implemented. 11,473 children reached by the end of 2019.

title.narrative: 2.2 Policy/Strategy: Existence of valid national social protection strategy and/or policy

actual.value: 2019:Due to Ministerial changes the new drafts of the law and policy for social action were put on hold, but the expectation is that it will gain traction under the new Minister.

title.narrative: 1.1 National government measurement of child poverty using multidimensional measures

target.value: 2019:Multidimensional Poverty measurement exists and is used by government

actual.value: 2019:Multidimensional poverty measure was published back in 2018. It will be next updated in 2020, the date when the survey on which it is based (Multiple Indicators and Health Survey) is due to take place.

title.narrative: Pilot of cash transfer programme is in place(36930)

target.value: 2019:Pilot strengthened and being prepared for scale-up

actual.value: 2019:The pilot took off in 2019. UNICEF with MASFAMU and other stakeholders such as the National Bank of Angola jointly worked in the programme implementation. Confirmation process of beneficiaries took place and two cycles of payments were made, totalling 6 m
